How can the brain differentiate between a thought and an action since both have the same direction through the mind, what makes the mind not follow through with an action, or what makes the mind think of a thought, if you think about doing something can you differentiate between that and actually doing it if you don't have feedback from any part of you?

post_info.post_title: Difference between a thought and an action

Not sure, I think everyone is familiar with the feeling of not being sure whether you have said something out loud or not.

yeah, many people i know have had that feeling, including me...
 
 but say you made sure you couldn't have any feedback to your brain from any part of your body, and you thought of throwing a pen or something, if you reconnected all those feedback systems, did you throw that pen or not?
Consciously directed thought is a kind of action.
